column1: #Text=John Kerry criticizes news media , joins call for inquiry on Downing Street Memo

#Text=In a swing through South Coast , Florida , former 2004 presidential candidate Senator John Kerry criticized the near silence of the U.S. mass media regarding the so-called " Downing Street Memo " .

column1: #Text=The Downing Street Memo is a leaked secret British document that details the minutes of a 2002 meeting between top-level British and American government officials .

#Text=The memo states that George W. Bush " was determined " to attack Iraq long before going to Congress with the matter , and that " the intelligence and facts were being fixed around the policy . "
#Text=The accuracy of the memo is not being disputed by either government .
#Text=The memo caused an uproar in Great Britain and made a significant impact in the British national elections , but has gotten little attention in American news .
#Text=" When I go back [ to Washington ] on Monday , I am going to raise the issue .

#Text= ... a debate has raged in the United States over the last year and one half about whether the obviously flawed intelligence that falsely stated that Iraq possessed weapons of mass destruction was a mere ' failure ' or the result of intentional manipulation to reach foreordained conclusions supporting the case for war .

#Text= If anyone wants to know how the intelligence was used by the administration , all they have to do is go back and look at all the public comments over the course of the lead-up to the war in Iraq , and that 's all very public information .

_	_	_	_

#Text=And in terms of the intelligence , it was wrong , and we are taking steps to correct that and make sure that in the future we have the best possible intelligence , because it 's critical in this post-September 11th age , that the executive branch has the best intelligence possible .
